name: Mineral Valleys Walk - Escomb, Witton Park & Etherley

ai.summary: A 9.6 km moderate hike that links Escomb, Witton Park and Etherley in the United Kingdom. The route blends country lanes, woodland trails, and open fields with gentle climbs, offering varied scenery and a comfortable workload for walkers with some experience and sturdy footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: Ground varies from compact country lanes and grassy field edges to forest tracks and rocky or uneven sections. Expect uneven surfaces, occasional mud after rain, and a few stile or gate crossings. The route offers rural valley views and glimpses of historic sites along the way.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and wear sturdy footwear. Bring a map or GPS and know the route. Let someone know your plan and estimated return time. Stay on marked paths; be aware of livestock on rural tracks and shared-use routes with cyclists. Carry water, snacks, a lightweight waterproof layer, and a small first aid kit. Be prepared for changing conditions, especially in exposed sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots with good grip
Map and/or GPS device (offline maps optional)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; winter walks are possible with proper gear and shorter daylight hours.
